verses.text: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four in all.
verses.comment: Direct listing matching earlier genealogies in Genesis.

verses.text: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, chiefs of their families, belonging to Tola, mighty warriors in their generations. Their number in David’s time was 22,600.
verses.comment: “Mighty warriors” (Heb. gibbor chayil); clarifies census in David’s era.

verses.text: The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah—five, all chiefs.
verses.comment: Simple listing, retaining original familial order.

verses.text: Alongside them, by their families, were troops for war: 36,000, for they had many wives and sons.
verses.comment: Clarifies the military census connected to their family growth.

verses.text: Their kinsmen among all the clans of Issachar, mighty warriors, were listed by genealogy as 87,000 in total.
verses.comment: Clarifies genealogical enumeration—consistent with Hebrew text.

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Beker, and Jediael—three in all.
verses.comment: Genealogy transitions to Benjamin; reconciles with earlier texts.

verses.text: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri—five, heads of their families, mighty warriors; their genealogical record was 22,034.
verses.comment: Literal enumeration of their military census.

verses.text: The sons of Beker: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were sons of Beker.
verses.comment: Maintains original sequence and names; reflects family units.

verses.text: They were enrolled by genealogy, heads of families, mighty warriors, 20,200 in all.
verses.comment: Military record corresponds to original enumeration.

verses.text: The son of Jediael: Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
verses.comment: Maintains the genealogical structure; matches Hebrew source.

verses.text: All these were sons of Jediael, chiefs of families, mighty warriors, 17,200 able to go out to war.
verses.comment: Preserves tradition of military enumeration in Chronicles.

verses.text: And Shuppim and Huppim were sons of Ir; Hushim was the son of Aher.
verses.comment: Alternate names noted in Genesis. 'Aher' possibly means 'another.'

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum—the descendants of Bilhah.
verses.comment: Consistent with Genesis, noting Bilhah as maidservant.

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his Aramean concubine bore; she also bore Machir, the father of Gilead.
verses.comment: Notes concubine; matches the original, no extra gloss.

verses.text: Machir took a wife from among the Huppites and Shuppites. The name of his sister was Maacah. The second was named Zelophehad, and Zelophehad had daughters.
verses.comment: Matching Numbers; maintains order of names and family details.

verses.text: Maacah, Machir’s wife, bore a son, and she named him Peresh. His brother was Sheresh, and Sheresh’s sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.comment: Follows original sequence and names.

verses.text: The sons of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, son of Manasseh.
verses.comment: Keeps genealogical chain clear and faithful.

verses.text: His sister Hammoleketh bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
verses.comment: Hammoleketh means ‘queen’; preserves as personal name.

verses.text: The sons of Shemida: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
verses.comment: Simple listing, fits genealogical format.

verses.text: The sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
verses.comment: Follows standard repetition and genealogy.

verses.text: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead, men of Gath, born in the land. The men of Gath killed them, because they came down to take their livestock.
verses.comment: Some ambiguity in the text about deaths clarified for modern English.

verses.text: Their father Ephraim mourned for many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
verses.comment: Reflects Hebrew phrase for comforting in grief.

verses.text: He went in to his wife, and she conceived and bore a son. He named him Beriah, because trouble had come to his house.
verses.comment: Beriah means ‘in trouble’; name explanation preserved.

verses.text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth-horon, and Uzzen-sheerah.
verses.comment: Sheerah’s building role is rare for a woman; kept without alteration.

verses.text: Rephah was his son, Resheph, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
verses.comment: Genealogical sequence maintained without additional detail.

verses.text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
verses.comment: Straightforward genealogical format.

verses.text: Nun his son, Joshua his son.
verses.comment: Genealogy links directly to Joshua, Moses’s successor.

verses.text: Their lands and settlements included Bethel and its villages, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer and its villages, Shechem and its villages, and Ayyah and its villages.
verses.comment: Land allocation corresponds to the Ephraimite territory.

verses.text: Also Beth-shan, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor with their villages. In these lived the descendants of Joseph son of Israel.
verses.comment: Taken directly from the territorial assignments in Joshua.

verses.text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah; and their sister Serah.
verses.comment: Genealogy ties to Asher; Serah is notable for being mentioned.

verses.text: The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
verses.comment: Follows original order and naming.

verses.text: Heber’s sons: Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
verses.comment: Maintains genealogical records including female sibling.

verses.text: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were Japhlet’s sons.
verses.comment: Names kept in original Hebraic form.

verses.text: The sons of Shomer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
verses.comment: Order kept consistent with the source text.

verses.text: The sons of Helem his brother: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
verses.comment: Direct recitation of names.

verses.text: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
verses.comment: Maintains original family grouping.

verses.text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
verses.comment: Follows the original sequence for completeness.

verses.text: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
verses.comment: Genealogy continued without embellishment.

verses.text: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
verses.comment: Matches Hebrew text for these individual names.

verses.text: All of these were descendants of Asher, heads of families, choice mighty warriors, chiefs among the princes. Their genealogy listed 26,000 men fit for war.
verses.comment: Summarizes Asher's tribe; 'mighty warriors' clarifies 'men of valor.'
